isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - POWER TAKE OFF: ROCKWELL REAR ENGINE MOUNTED

svcsection.title: POWER TAKE OFF: ROCKWELL REAR ENGINE MOUNTED

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The Rockwell Rear Engine Power Take Off (REPTO) is a heavy duty unit installed between the engine and the transmission. It replaces the standard flywheel housing and provides mounting for the engine starter and flywheel. Power from the engine is direct to the REPTO and is not dependent on the vehicle clutch or transmission. This live PTO feature makes it suitable for applications such as packer, dump or mixer trucks.

item.para: Special bolts are used in tapped holes to remove the gear case cover. Five (5) tapped holes on the cover perimeter are 3/8-24 UNF threads. Two (2) tapped holes on the cover at the idler gear position are 5/16-24 UNF threads.
There is only one PTO position. This positions the output at 1 o'clock.
Tolerance rings and outer rings are used in all bearing positions.
Tolerance rings must be replaced during rebuild.
All bearings are ball type bearings.
The REPTO is lubricated by the engine. Refer to LUBRICATION
A large diameter dowel with through hole is used to support the gear cover adjacent to the PTO gear.
